definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: It could make you more alert and help you avoid an afternoon energy slump.
sentences.chinese: 它能让你更加清醒，还能帮你避免下午犯困。

sentences.english: This effect might be the main reason for the desired post-lunch siesta.
sentences.chinese: 这可能就是午后犯困的主要原因了。

sentences.english: In online surveys, students reported feeling less sleepy during the day.
sentences.chinese: 网上调查发现，学生普遍认为这样白天就很少犯困了。

sentences.english: After a while he began to feel sleepy and decided that he would lie down and disgest his meal in comfort.
sentences.chinese: 不一会儿他有些犯困，便决定还是先躺下来消消食。

sentences.english: Son：I know, but I promise I won't be sleepy tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，但是我保证明天不犯困。

sentences.english: Using sleep aids daily can cause dependancy and drowsiness during your shift.
sentences.chinese: 睡眠辅助性药物可能产生出依赖，在上夜班时犯困。

sentences.english: I lay comfortably in his arms and I begin to feel sleepy as usual.
sentences.chinese: 我舒舒服服地躺在他臂弯里，像往常一样开始犯困。

sentences.english: Sleep more and feel drowsy during the daytime.
sentences.chinese: 睡眠时间变长，白天容易犯困。

sentences.english: You’ll be sleepy all day tomorrow if you don’t sleep well tonight.
sentences.chinese: 如果你今晚上不休息好的话，明天一天你都会犯困的。

sentences.english: So next time I get that 3 p. m. slow down, I'll have an egg.
sentences.chinese: 所以下次在下午3点犯困的时候，我会吃个鸡蛋。

sentences.english: I always feel sleepy in English classes.
sentences.chinese: 在英语课上我总是犯困。

definition: variant of 頭昏腦脹|头昏脑胀[tou2 hun1 nao3 zhang4]
